Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, AccesstoKnowledge
Organisation: Institute for Advanced Technology and Public Policy, California Polytechnic State University
Kurzzusammenfassung: An AI-driven digital wire service that can automatically generate news articles, drafts and associated media content from structured legislative information sources.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, DiscourseIntervention, Democracy
Kurzzusammenfassung: We developed an AI chat assistant to act as an at-scale, real-time moderator in divisive political conversations. The assistant makes tailored suggestions on how to rephrase specific texts in the course of a live, online conversation, without fundamentally affecting the policy content or position taken in the messages.

We're developing open-source software so the broader climate modeling community can easily adopt our advances. Our partnership with GFDL ensures our work builds on their valuable experience and has the quickest impact. This collaboration brings our team’s innovation together with GFDL’s climate modeling experience and computing resources to achieve quicker impacts that can set an example for other climate modeling centers.

Status: still in research, no tool yet
Kurzzusammenfassung: AI methods and technologies are to be developed that enable efficient, rapid and automated monitoring of biodiversity in various habitats and landscapes in order to track the development of ecosystems, species communities and populations and to analyse the causes of changes.
The project aimed to establish a platform for sustainable urban mobility in which climate protection and resource efficiency are structurally anchored. The result was a prototype.

Einsatzbereich: Life on land, SustainableAgriculture, NatureConservation, Biodiversity
Kurzzusammenfassung: Insect populations, such as bumblebees or bees, are tracked using computer vision. The aim is to measure the effects of human influences, such as agricultural techniques or substances, and environmental influences

Organisation: IGB Leibniz-Institut für Gewässerökologie und Binnenfischerei
Kurzzusammenfassung: AI-based optical methods for the detection of microorganisms in aquatic ecosystems.

Organisation: Deutsches Zentrum für Luft- und Raumfahrt e.V. (DLR), Concentrating Solar Power España S.L (CSPS), Industrial Solar GmbH, Technische Universität München, Forschungszentrum Jülich GmbH, fortiss GmbH
Kurzzusammenfassung: AI methods for heat and power generation with solar thermal collector systems

The company is developing an avatar that translates text into sign language. The motivation is to improve participation and accessibility. It is being realised in collaboration with other companies and research institutes, including sign language experts. A sign language text output is planned, but there is currently no dialogue option or sign language input.

In collaboration with the New York bike-sharing provider Citi Bike, researchers have developed an application that can be used to ‘fill’ bike stations in a more targeted manner so that customers always have access to bikes.

A camera system has been developed to detect and protect wind-sensitive bird species. Approaching birds are to be recognised via computer vision and DL and the rotors stopped if a so-called ‘dangerous flight’ is detected. This is intended to counteract the current impediment to the expansion of wind turbines.

This annual profile, created with One Ocean Foundation, fills a critical gap in sustainability reporting: while most companies issue reports focused on land environments, none address what’s happening in our seas. They enlisted generative AI, powered by OpenAI, to analyze the sustainability reports of about 2,500 companies (300,000 pages in total) across 17 sectors, representing more than 70 percent of the world’s market capitalization. With help from McKinsey and QuantumBlack, One Ocean Foundation will evolve this year’s report into an Ocean Disclosure Initiative, a framework that businesses can use to track their marine-related projects. It could be thought of as the next wave in sustainability reporting.

Einsatzbereich: Good Health and Well-Being, PublicHealth, KnowledgeTransfer
Kurzzusammenfassung: The C-19 chatbot will be used by the authorities to communicate information about coronavirus to citizens.

The aim of the project is to be able to provide efficient routes for cargo bikes on an individual basis. To this end, roads and paths are assessed for their ‘cargo bike friendliness’ (CargoBikeIndex). Volunteers can contribute data for their district via mapathons. The focus is on commercial users in urban areas.
CariFIX is a web-based platform that Caritas counsellors can use to network and exchange information on specific questions from their day-to-day work - throughout Germany

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, AntiDiscrimination
Kurzzusammenfassung: In the CAROLL project, the computer scientists working with Prof Dr Mitrović combine numerical approaches such as machine learning with findings from the millennia-old art of rhetoric. Computer-aided rhetoric is an approach to natural language processing (NLP). The Passau team combines this approach with argumentation mining, also a research area within NLP.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, KnowledgeInfrastructure
Organisation: DAI-Labor der TU Berlin in Kooperation mit ITDZ Berlin
Kurzzusammenfassung: ‘Bobbi’ is a multilingual chatbot for questions relating to the Berlin administration. It has nine languages and is based on DeepL.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, PublicAdministration
Kurzzusammenfassung: The chatbot is designed to optimise users' information searches and provide individual information faster than before.

Cider is a set of software tools for targeting poverty with mobile phone data. It was developed jointly by the Global Policy Lab at UC Berkeley, the Center for Effective Global Action (CEGA) at UC Berkeley, and the non-profit GiveDirectly. Cider is based on the poverty targeting methods described in Aiken et al. (2022). A goal of cider is to make these methods easier to use and replicable across contexts. A second goal is making it straightforward to compare targeting methods, including the phone-based approach built by cider: while the empirical results on the accuracy of the phone-based approach in Aiken et al. (2022) are promising, it is still not known how the phone-based approach compares to alternatives across contexts. Because cider works on digital data, it has two significant strengths: it can identify and reach people rapidly (speed) and do so on the order of millions of people (scale).

Art: Computer vision, Satellite imagery, ML, Visualization
Kurzzusammenfassung: Climate TRACE is a non-profit coalition of organizations building a timely, open, and accessible inventory of exactly where greenhouse gas emissions are coming from. We make meaningful climate action faster and easier by harnessing technology to track greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions with unprecedented detail and speed, delivering information that is relevant to all parties working to achieve net-zero global emissions.

Organisation: Hochschule Osnabrück, AMAZONEN-WERKE H. DREYER SE & Co. KG
Kurzzusammenfassung: The aim of ‘CognitiveWeeding’ is to develop new ways of weed control by changing our view of the flora that accompanies arable crops. When planning the control measures, the extent to which weeds are controlled or weeds tolerated or temporarily not controlled must be weighed up in order to increase plant biodiversity and create/preserve habitats and food sources for insects.

Organisation: Inclusive Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Foundation
Kurzzusammenfassung: I-Stem provides AI-powered services that allow people with disabilities to convert inaccessible content into accessible and usable formats that they can independently access using their assistive technology

AI-based classification system of CoVid rapid tests for visually impaired and blind people. Vision is a free and easily accessible open-source computer vision app that can classify CoVid rapid test results with mobile devices.

Crossfoam analyses and visualises filter bubbles in social networks. This gives users the opportunity to recognise whether their ‘own’ online community is an echo chamber or brings together different opinions. Detailed analyses allow users to explore the social network, make it more diverse or - if desired - make it even more specific. The project was funded by Prototypefund.

The aim is to close the gap between the collection of used textiles and targeted sorting for second-hand and fibre-to-fibre recycling using AI-supported spectroscopy and image analysis, thus enabling a continuous material cycle.

Einsatzbereich: Sustainable Cities and Communities, SustainableMobility, PublicSafety
Kurzzusammenfassung: Cycle AI trains an AI model that categorises how safe an environment is for cyclists.  Volunteers can mark danger spots for cyclists on a map. On the website, interested parties can contribute to a data set by rating which of two photos shows the more cycle-friendly environment.

Organisation: Verbundprojekt von Wuppertal Institut, GreenDelta GmbH, SKZ-KFE gGmbH
Kurzzusammenfassung: Cyclops aims to optimise the recyclability of secondary plastics by introducing a digital support system. will provide a platform on which they can identify technically, economically and ecologically viable uses for the plastic waste and recyclates available on the market and make purchasing, recycling and marketing decisions based on these assessments.
DataKind is an organisation that brings pro bono data scientists together with humanitarian organisations.

Realisation of the findings from the previous DC-HEAT project. The aim is to create an AI lighthouse for the use of waste heat from data centres using Frankfurt as an example. DC2HEAT is intended to help ensure that the dynamically growing data centre infrastructure can be operated in a climate-friendly manner.

‘Decoding Antisemitism’ is an interdisciplinary and transnational research project that investigates antisemitism on the internet with the help of AI, focussing on the political mainstream of selected European societies - the UK, France and Germany.

Organisation: Verbundprojekt von Fachgebiet Siedlungswasserwirtschaft der Universität Kassel (Verbundkoordinator), UNISENSOR Sensorsysteme GmbH, Forschungsinstitut ifak e.V., das Ingenieurbüro Weber-Ingenieure GmbH und der Lippeverband
Kurzzusammenfassung: The DecS project pursues the vision of removing organic trace substances from wastewater streams in a targeted manner and relieving the strain on the resources required for this with the available technologies (ozone, powdered activated carbon, granulated activated carbon).

Organisation: Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft zur Förderung der angewandten Forschung e.V. (Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Energiesystemtechnik), Universität Kassel (Fachgebiet Intelligente Eingebettete Systeme), Christian-Albrechts-Universität zu Kiel (Arbeitsgruppe Intelligente Systeme), Technische Universität Chemnitz (Fakultät für Informatik - Professur Medieninformatik)
Kurzzusammenfassung: The project has the potential to better reconcile the expansion of wind energy with nature and species conservation.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, DetectDisinformation
Kurzzusammenfassung: The defalsif-AI research project is developing media forensic tools that allow users to make an initial assessment of the credibility of text, image, video or audio material on the internet. Artificial intelligence is used in the process. The project focuses in particular on politically motivated disinformation. The aim is to demonstrate a valid tool for analysing digital content on the internet that enables an initial assessment of the credibility and/or authenticity of texts, images, videos or audio. This creates the basis for further recommendations for action.

Organisation: Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft zur Förderung der angewandten Forschung e. V., acp systems AG, United Nations Institute for Training and Research (UNITAR), Deprag Schulz GmbH u. Co.
Kurzzusammenfassung: The project uses artificial intelligence to automate the recycling process for small electrical appliances.

Organisation: RIF e.V. Institut für Forschung und Transfer
Kurzzusammenfassung: In order to meet the high demands placed on recycling processes in the future, they must be expanded to include sensors and digital twins. An intelligent linking of data and algorithms will contribute to the efficient control of recycling plants. The vision of the DiKueRec project is to guarantee the safe and efficient treatment of current and future refrigerator models.

Earth Species Project (ESP) is a non-profit research lab and impact organization focused on using artificial intelligence to advance our understanding of animal communication, and ultimately to decode non-human languages.

EarthRanger is a software solution that aids protected area managers, ecologists, and wildlife biologists in making more informed operational decisions for wildlife conservation. EarthRanger collects, integrates, and displays all historical and available remote sensing data available and combines it with reports from the field to provide one unified view of collared wildlife, rangers, enforcement assets, and infrastructure within a protected area.

Organisation: Hasso-Plattner-Institut für Digital Engineering gGmbH, Technische Universität München (School of Engineering and Design), Helmholtz-Zentrum Potsdam (Deutsches GeoForschungsZentrum)
Kurzzusammenfassung: The project is developing an AI-based precipitation forecast for Germany that can be used to predict extreme weather events in particular.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, PublicAdministration
Kurzzusammenfassung: The checking of enrolment certificates for the approval of child benefit is to be automated and therefore faster and less labour-intensive.

Einsatzbereich: Decent Work and Economic Growth, SupportingPhysicalWork
Kurzzusammenfassung: Working on a construction site demands a lot from employees. High levels of physical strain occur not only when lifting and carrying, but also when working in forced postures. These include prolonged overhead activities such as electrical installation or filling, wallpapering and painting ceilings - physically demanding tasks that can be made easier with exoskeletons.

Free app that allows you to control other apps using eye movements. EyeCaptain uses eye tracking, a technology that allows you to measure which area of your screen is being looked at. An infrared camera on the end device, e.g. the tablet, recognises the pupils. Control is then based on the movements of the eyes: for example, if you look at an app icon for a longer period of time, the app opens.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, DetectDisinformation
Kurzzusammenfassung: Factalite is a natural language semi-automated chatbot for WhatsApp and other private messaging apps, linked to a centralized database and platform designed to tackle disinformation circulating on private messaging platforms in all formats: text, audio, image, and video.

Organisation: Technische Universität Ilmenau, Max-Planck-Gesellschaft zur Förderung der Wissenschaften e. V.
Kurzzusammenfassung: The existing ‘Flora Incognita’ app (https://floraincognita.com/) is to be expanded to include additional species. The application, which uses computer vision to automatically classify plant species, enables large-scale monitoring of biodiversity and has an educational effect.

Organisation: Hochschule für Technik und Wirtschaft des Saarlandes, Technische Hochschule Bingen, Mittelrheinstrom UG (haftungsbeschränkt) & Co. 560 KG
Kurzzusammenfassung: The project aims to use artificial intelligence to drive forward the expansion of electricity generation from hydropower and the environmentally friendly production of renewable energies.

Einsatzbereich: Responsible Consumption and Production, ReducingFoodwaste, KnowledgeInfrastructure
Kurzzusammenfassung: Foodforecast has developed an AI that analyzes historical sales figures from bakery outlets and combines them with important influencing factors to create an automated sales forecast for the next day's order. In this way, foodforecast wants to help ensure that less food ends up in the garbage can.
Single-tree-based, satellite-based forest ecosystem monitoring using autoadaptive hyperdimensions - geodata analysis

Projektname: Frag nach! – Die interaktiven Zeitzeugnisse von Inge Auerbacher und Kurt S. Maier
Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, PreservingHistoricalMemories, RememberingWitnesses, KnowledgeTransfer
Organisation: Deutsche Exilarchiv 1933-1945 (Deutsche Nationalbibliothek), USC Shoah Foundation - The Institute for Visual History and Education
Kurzzusammenfassung: Since September 2023, the German Exile Archive 1933-1945 has been showing the exhibition "Frag nach! Digitale interaktive Interviews mit Inge Auerbacher und Kurt S. Maier", which is dedicated to the life stories and memories of contemporary witness Inge Auerbacher and contemporary witness Kurt S. Maier. The exile archive is trialling a new form of digital testimony that aims to preserve the possibility of interviewing contemporary witnesses for the future. Visitors to the exhibition can already enter into a dialogue with the digital interactive interview with Kurt S. Maier. Speech recognition software converts the verbal questions into text data. Natural language processing is used to compare the questions with the content of a database. The appropriate response sequence is then played out.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, PublicAdministration
Kurzzusammenfassung: The administration chatbot ‘Frag den Michel’ answers questions about administrative services.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, PublicDiscourse
Kurzzusammenfassung: Full fact is a non-profit initiative that uses AI to provide trend monitoring and clustering tools to help fact checkers analyse news and other information.

Organisation: wetransform GmbH, M.O.S.S. Computer Graphik Systeme GmbH, Freie Universität Berlin (FU), Technische Universität München (TUM), ECOSOPH GmbH
Kurzzusammenfassung: Use of AI to analyse forest condition, assess future forest development and prepare decisions on climate-adapted forest conversion

Organisation: Karl Engelhardt, Charlotte Friedrich, Felix Haak & Philipp Müller GbR
Kurzzusammenfassung: The desire for inclusive language is increasingly taking centre stage in both public and private text creation. To help users with the typical linguistic problems that arise in the process (‘doctor's salary or doctor's salary?’), we offer a simple and user-friendly software solution that, unlike traditional prescriptive reference works, actually maps language as it is used by text creators.

Einsatzbereich: Good Health and Well-Being, PublicHealth, AccesstoKnowledge
Kurzzusammenfassung: The Vision is a free and easily accessible open-source general computer vision system that covers a wide range of diseases and can process different types of input images (photos, X-rays, CT and MRI scans, etc.).

Project Connect seeks to reduce the digital divide in education by mapping schools and their equipment, and provides detailed background information on how data sets and software are used. ML is used to recognise schools using computer vision on satellite images and to categorise their facilities (especially internet connectivity).

Einsatzbereich: Affordable and Clean Energy, EnvironmentalMonitoring, AggregatingKnowledge
Art: Computer vision, Satellite imagery, ML, Visualization
Organisation: Microsoft Corp., Planet Labs PBC and The Nature Conservancy
Kurzzusammenfassung: A first-of-its-kind living atlas intended to map and measure all utility-scale solar and wind installations on Earth using artificial intelligence (AI) and satellite imagery, allowing users to evaluate clean energy transition progress and track trends over time.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, PublicAdministration
Kurzzusammenfassung: Govii is an intelligent bot that can answer questions on all official topics. Among other things, Govii relies on existing public administration responsibility information. To do this, it searches large number of interfaces and (XÖV) standards to find the right information.

Organisation: Hochschule Trier – Umwelt Campus Birkenfeld, PSI Logistics GmbH, DFKI, RWTH Aachen
Kurzzusammenfassung: The GreenTwin project is dedicated to the development of sustainable regional logistics in rural areas using artificial intelligence.

The starting point is a classification problem: In order to decide whether a data point (e.g. a craft enterprise) is included in a statistic, it must be classified as relevant or not relevant. Until now, this has been done manually. However, this takes a lot of time and is also prone to errors. Furthermore, there is only limited personnel capacity for this. Solution approach: supplementary. Using previously determined classification patterns for entities (information from company registers), a classification system is trained that automatically categorises new data points as relevant or not relevant. Clerks are given the same time window as before to continue processing the now pre-sorted cases

Einsatzbereich: Good Health and Well-Being, AccesstoKnowledge, PublicHealth
Kurzzusammenfassung: The City of Helsinki's health centre chatbot is a chatbot that provides answers to questions about mental health or substance abuse, for example, and refers users to other digital services offered by the health centres.
The aim of the i-SEWER project is to develop a methodology for the development of scalable, autonomous and AI-driven sewer network control systems to reduce discharges from the combined sewer system.

Einsatzbereich: Sustainable Cities and Communities, CrisisResponse, ClimateResearch
Organisation: Albert-Ludwigs-Universität Freiburg, Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft zur Förderung der angewandten Forschung e. V.
Kurzzusammenfassung: The aim of I4C is to improve the adaptation of cities to climate change through a process chain from data collection, analysis and environmental forecasting to concrete measures. The Chair of Environmental Meteorology is involved in the project with two sub-projects, which are intended to enable the downscaling of thermal comfort and stress on a local, building-resolved scale using AI and the prediction of storm impacts and storm damage using large eddy simulations (LES) and AI.

The results of IDETECT, our natural language processing and supervised machine learning tool, are displayed in a platform (IDMC monitors) that displays information about reported incidents of conflict and the occurrence of natural hazards

Das IMMS (Intelligent Material Management System) ist ein intelligentes Management System, das genutzt wird, um den gesamten Bestand zu organisieren. Es ermöglicht die Ausleihe und Rückgabe an allen Zweigstellen der Bibliothek. Der Bestand umfasst ca. 1,8 mio Artikel.

Projektname:
K2I (Künstliche und kollektive Intelligenz zum Spurenstoff-Tracking in 
Oberflächenwasser für eine nachhaltige Trinkwassergewinnung K2I)
Organisation: Verbundprojekt von Landeswasserversorgung, das Leibniz-Rechenzentrum der Bayerischen Akademie der Wissenschaften, die Technische Universität München mit ihrem Lehrstuhl für Analytische Chemie und Wasserchemie, und das TZW: DVGW-Technologiezentrum Wasser
Kurzzusammenfassung: A cross-laboratory cloud solution is to be developed with which water suppliers can quickly detect organic trace substances and narrow down possible sources on the basis of a supra-regional database.
Use of artificial intelligence methods for optimised rail operations of the future

Art: ML, Improving the quality of images
Kurzzusammenfassung: One of the promising opportunities for the use of this technology in healthcare that has attracted the interest of researchers is imaging. By harnessing the power of this exciting technology, researchers can now improve the quality of medical images. In line with this trend and advances in the field of medical imaging, the AI-INSPIRE project aims to optimise the quality of medical images for interventions and help clinicians in their decision-making. The project will have a direct impact on the radiation protection of patients undergoing surgical procedures with the aid of medical imaging systems. The technology developed in this project will make it possible to obtain noisy images at a low dose and then remove the noise from the image, resulting in an image of acceptable quality., Künstliche Intelligenz für den innovativen nachhaltigen Strahlenschutz von Patienten in interventionellen radiologischen Einsatzgebieten
Optimisation of bulky waste disposal with AI

Webseite-Link: Quelle: KI im Behördeneinsatz: Erfahrungen und Empfehlungen, 2020
Kurzzusammenfassung: The traffic flow in the test city is to be optimised through the automated control of traffic lights based on real-time data. The aim is to shorten transit times and reduce noise.

A computer algorithm developed at Carnegie Mellon University matched living kidney donors with medically compatible transplant candidates late last month as the national Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network (OPTN), operated by the United Network for Organ Sharing (UNOS), began a national pilot program to increase the number of kidney paired-donation (KPD) transplants.

Organisation: August Wilhelm Scheer Institut für digitale Produkte und Prozesse gGmbH
Kurzzusammenfassung: The aim of KIKI is to enrich the inspection procedures for the maintenance of sewers with AI methods so that automatic damage detection based on image data is possible.

Organisation: Variolytics GmbH, Hohenstaufenstadt Göppingen (Stadtentwässerung Göppingen), Universität Kassel (Fachgebiet Siedlungswasserwirtschaft, Institut für Wasser, Abfall, Umwelt), Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft zur Förderung der angewandten Forschung e. V. (Institut für Grenzflächen- und Bioverfahrenstechnik)
Kurzzusammenfassung: The joint project aims to use artificial intelligence to control wastewater treatment processes in a climate-optimised way and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

‘Kilkari’ are described as IVR chatbots, and the website states with regard to AI: “Integrating Artificial Intelligence (AI) for program improvement, creation of targeted programs and prediction of high-risk conditions and beneficiary behaviour in partnership with Google Research India”. Belongs to a non-profit organisation based in India that uses mHealth to develop cost-effective, gender-specific solutions to improve pregnant women's and mothers' access to preventive information and services, and to train health workers to reduce maternal and child mortality and morbidity.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, PublicDiscourse
Kurzzusammenfassung: Kindly is – an open-source API that detects abusive and cyberbullying intent in messages and provides instant feedback for users to reconsider their message.

Organisation: Trägerverein Umweltbildungszentrum Listhof e.V., Berliner Hochschule für Technik
Kurzzusammenfassung: An insect counter is to be developed that automates the counting and identification of insects. For this purpose, not only image data, but also optoacoustic signals for the wingbeat, combined with weather or vegetation data, should enable identification.

Organisation: Forschungszentrum Jülich GmbH, Universität zu Köln, 52° North Initiative for Geospatial Open Source Software GmbH, Rheinisch-Westfälische Technische Hochschule Aachen, Rheinische Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität Bonn, Ambrosys GmbH
Kurzzusammenfassung: An AI strategy for earth system data to analyse, process and provide environmental changes.

Status: in research (development and implementation of the ideas developed in the pilot phase)
Kurzzusammenfassung: Continuation of Kite: The AI-supported application to be developed in the KITE project is intended to support female founders in becoming more resilient in dealing with discriminatory experiences in the start-up process - e.g. by preparing for difficult situations.

Organisation: B2M Software GmbH, THD – Technische Hochschule Deggendorf, Quantum-Systems GmbH, Universität Bayreuth
Kurzzusammenfassung: The project supplements existing systems for early forest fire detection with artificial intelligence, making them more sustainable and efficient.

The Komp-HI project is focussing on the promotion of technical and interdisciplinary skills through the socio-technical design of hybrid intelligence systems. The project aims to use AI to support learners in building and developing important skills in parallel with subject-specific content. The basic idea of the project is based on the provision of individualised learning materials as well as individual and formative feedback throughout the entire learning process. AI-based learning innovations require the most accurate possible analysis of individual competences at the start of learning and the recording of learning progress in order to be able to accompany individualised learning processes as well as possible and provide competence-related feedback.

Organisation: Hochschule Reutlingen, Korn Recycling GmbH, LuxFlux GmbH
Kurzzusammenfassung: The aim of the project is to automatically recognise unsorted but recyclable materials in real time. Without sorting, these would have to be incinerated. For this purpose, a database is being set up that includes hyperspectral images (mapping of chemical characteristics) of waste. This will serve as the basis for an AI system to categorise material classes. Additional sensor data will later be used for comparison in the implementation.

Farmers in Uganda often lack adequate information about the country's agricultural market, which puts them at a disadvantage when selling their produce. Kudu is an electronic agricultural market designed to facilitate the flow of information. "The Kudu AI interface. Deal coordinators were shown matches corresponding to the largest gains from trade."

Art: Computer vision, Satellite imagery, ML, Visualization
Kurzzusammenfassung: Environmental scientists use satellite and aerial imagery to understand patterns of land use, in particular to understand the impacts of climate change and human population expansion on Earth’s natural resources. However, distilling imagery into actionable data – in the form of land cover maps – currently requires extensive manual annotation. This work uses computer vision to accelerate this process, allowing environmental scientists and geospatial analysts to spend less time drawing polygons and more time on conservation planning.

Lindera is developing an app that is particularly aimed at senior citizens and allows them to film their own walking behaviour. It then calculates the risk of falling and suggests possible solutions, such as balance exercises or readjusting walking aids. Lindera is a commercial company with no directly recognisable public interest motivation.

Art: Computer vision, Satellite imagery, ML, visualization
Kurzzusammenfassung: Together with Alexander Thamm we have recently launched a project that will use computer vision and satellite imagery to create a global map of marine litter to provide transparency on this issue, facilitate research and enable improvements to coordinate marine clean-up efforts! The aim of the project is to create a computer vision system equipped with artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) that is able to identify plastic and other marine litter floating in the oceans and seas, as well as its position and size, using satellite images in (near) real time and make this information available to researchers, environmentalists, activists, authorities and other organisations free of charge.

Einsatzbereich: Good Health and Well-Being, AccesstoKnowledge, PublicHealth
Kurzzusammenfassung: Der Chatbot NeRo wird von der City of Helsinki’s maternity and child health clinic genutzt, um Fragen der PatientInnen in Bezug auf Schwangerschaft, Geburt und frühe Kindheit zu beantworten.

Einsatzbereich: Good Health and Well-Being, AccesstoKnowledge, PublicHealth
Kurzzusammenfassung: This is a government chatbot in local language (voice and text) for citizens to receive access information and assistance, as well as to provide feedback. Furthermore, "contamination cases are tracked via this interface. The aim is to overcome access and literacy barriers.

Organisation: Wuppertal Institut für Klima, Umwelt, Energie gGmbH, Fraunhofer-Institut für Optronik, Systemtechnik und Bildauswertung (IOSB), Folkwang Universität der Künste
Kurzzusammenfassung: Design of circular metal management using metal strategy and AI support

Projektname: Methods for Extremely Rapid Observation of Nutritional Status (MERON)
Organisation: Kimetrica (Affiliate of the American Institutes for Research)
Status: ended 2019, unclear if it still or ever worked
Kurzzusammenfassung: MERON is a smartphone app that leverages deep learning technology to map facial features from photos and quickly detect malnutrition in children under five.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, PublicAdministration
Organisation: Amt für IT und Digitalisierung in der Senatskanzlei der Freien und Hansestadt Hamburg, Fraunhofer Institut
Kurzzusammenfassung: Parents are required by law to provide the registry office with information for certification purposes in the first few days after the birth of their child, to establish the name and thus to fulfil the first formal requirement for receiving parental and child benefit. The system simplifies this process because, as a natural language system, it is designed to break down language barriers and support the application process.

Organisation: Technische Universität Ilmenau, Max-Planck-Gesellschaft zur Förderung der Wissenschaften e. V.
Kurzzusammenfassung: A workflow platform for AI-based species identification

The "neverending altruistic donor" initiative (NEAD) chain algorithm, designed by Prof. Tuomas Sandholm, is used weekly by the United Network for Organ Sharing (UNOS) for their kidney exchange. He  won the "AAAI for the Benefit of Humanity" Award this year.

Organisation: Disy Informationssysteme GmbH, Fraunhofer IOSB, Karlsruher Institut für Technologie (KIT) (Abteilung Hydrogeologie), TZW: DVGW-Technologiezentrum Wasser
Kurzzusammenfassung: The intelligent system for the sustainable reduction of nitrate in groundwater is to use AI to predict the proportion of nitrate in groundwater and thus enable adequate response and prevention.

This is a chatbot that recommends books based on a context analysis. The target group is the customers of the Helsinki library, the recommended books are available there. There are six different chatbot agents, each focussing on different topics.

The aim of this research project is to network the data from different companies and processes and to optimise the recycling cycle across the board with the help of big data approaches and selected AI tools. The prototype of an AI application will be developed and used to optimise the material cycle from the collection and sorting of waste paper to the production of the paper product and thus make a significant contribution to reducing the resources required.

Projektname: Open Source tool for lung cancer clinicians
Kurzzusammenfassung: Aided anti-trafficking efforts at border crossings and airports by combining data across locations and surfacing insights that give interviewers greater intelligence about the right questions to ask and how to direct them.

Two years ago, the Estonian government worked out potential problems that the use of AI could solve. In October 2020, the EUIF decision support tool for advisors (OTT for short) went live. The OTT decision support system is a tool that helps unemployment insurance advisors to quickly and effectively collect and analyse data on an unemployed person (i.e. the customer). At the same time, it is possible to take into account the economic situation and predict the chances of finding a new job in a data-supported and automated manner.
OTT relies on the use of artificial intelligence. More specifically, the "Random Forest" machine learning model, which was trained and tested on the basis of unemployment data from the last five years. Based on this specific model and 60 different attributes and indicators, each unemployed person is assessed and their chances of finding a new job are calculated.
This is a chatbot that uses GPS data to provide information about the city of Helsinki's car park system.

The technology can be trained to identify and map specific environmental aspects, such as seabed pollution from plastic waste, the impact of climate change on the seabed, the degradation of underwater structures, the occurrence of invasive algae, biodiversity, the effectiveness of seabed restoration measures or algae growth for biofuels.

After installation, the application localises the location of the smartphone and asks about the type of cultivation of the plant, whether in the garden or in the field. After taking a photo of a diseased plant, computer vision is used to make a diagnosis and provide possible tips for treating the plant.

Organisation: Deutsches Forschungszentrum für Künstliche Intelligenz GmbH, OPTIMARE Systems GmbH, Jade Hochschule Wilhelmshaven/Oldenburg/Elsflet, everwave GmbH
Kurzzusammenfassung: Detecting plastic waste in the sea from the air: The ‘PlasticObs_plus’ project aims to identify sources and distribution routes of plastic waste using aerial vehicles and AI.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, PublicDiscourse
Kurzzusammenfassung: Politrack compares the poll results of the German parties with the topics discussed in the major German newspapers. For example: from X to Y, the plagiarism allegations against Baerbock were a major topic in the newspapers, how did the poll results of the Greens behave during this period? The project was funded by the Prototypefund.

Projektname: Predicting public health risks from restaurant reviews
Organisation: Yelp, Harvard University, City of Boston, DrivenData
Kurzzusammenfassung: Case Study: Flagged public health risks at restaurants by combining Yelp reviews with open city data on past inspections. An algorithmic approach discovers 25% more violations with the same number of inspections.

Organisation: University of Southern California Center for AI in Society
Kurzzusammenfassung: The project attempts to use ML to predict the behaviour of poachers. The model learns the poachers' behavioural models from the collected crime data. On this basis, PAWS calculates patrol routes and the probability of their success.
Project AEDES, by CirroLytix is a tool that correlates dengue cases and deaths with real-time data from climate, google searches, and remote sensing, to predict potential dengue hotspot locations.

Projektname: Project ZAMBA (Automating wildlife identification for research and conservation)
Organisation: Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology, Arcus Foundation, DrivenData
Kurzzusammenfassung: Detected wildlife in video footage—automatically and at scale—by running a global algorithm development challenge and building an open source application with the winning solution (Project Zamba).

Rainforest Connection setzt akustische Echtzeit-Überwachungssysteme ein, um illegale Abholzung vorherzusagen und zu verhindern. Sie werden in 22 Ländern, unter anderem auch Österreich, eingesetzt. Mithilfe von Deep Learning werden akustische Anomalien, die auf bevorstehende illegale Rodungen hindeuten, detektiert.

Einsatzbereich: Good Health and Well-Being, PublicHealth, AccesstoKnowledge
Organisation: Digital Umuganda, GIZ Digital Transformation Center
Kurzzusammenfassung: What should I do if I have a fever? How can I tell if I have coronavirus? The “RBC-Mbaza Chatbot” has the answers. It advises on questions about coronavirus, provides information on symptoms and prevention - and is getting better and better at it. This is because the chatbot is based on artificial intelligence. When Rwandans use it, they not only receive reliable answers, but the system also learns by memorizing helpful answers and frequently asked questions and linking them accordingly. The chatbot builds on existing information systems in Rwanda, including databases from the Biomedical Center and the Rwandan Information Society Authority.

Organisation: GreenDelta GmbH (mit Deutsches Forschungszentrum für Künstliche Intelligenz GmbH (DFKI), Technische Universität Darmstadt - FG Stoffstrommanagement und Ressourcenwirtschaft (SuR), Fraunhofer-Einrichtung für Wertstoffkreisläufe und Ressourcenstrategie (IWKS))
Kurzzusammenfassung: The aim is to improve recycling processes and thus strive for a more sustainable circular economy by simplifying the recycling of materials through digital lifecycle records and the use of AI, in the ‘Digital Lifecycle Record for the Circular Economy’ (ReCircE) project, material cycles are made transparent and waste sorting is optimised with the help of artificial intelligence.

Organisation: Hochschule Aalen - Hochschule für Technik und Wirtschaft, Gesellschaft im Ostalbkreis für Abfallbewirtschaftung mbH, GreenDelta GmbH, WeSort.Al GmbH, Holzer GmbH
Kurzzusammenfassung: The aim of the project is to increase the recycling rate of plastic waste. To this end, the sorting process is being optimised using artificial intelligence.

The application can be used, for example, to report waste, maintenance problems or dangerous road situations to the city administration. While users previously had to select the category and thus the responsibility, this process has now been automated with the help of NLP in order to prevent incorrect categorisation by users and speed up the rectification of the situation in question.

In this project, AI methods are applied to seismology. Machine learning and deep learning approaches are applied to earthquake data. To this end, new AI methods are being developed that can be used not only for understanding earthquakes, but also for other natural disasters. The resulting expertise will also be used in teaching and research. It could also be transferred to industrial applications.
Software for child and youth welfare centres, ‘How can social work, software development and science explore and apply the potential of artificial and human intelligence?’

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, DetectDisinformation, KnowledgeInfrastructure
Kurzzusammenfassung: This neural-network-based system, which we call SIDE, can identify Wikipedia citations that are unlikely to support their claims, and subsequently recommend better ones from the web. We train this model on existing Wikipedia references, therefore learning from the contributions and combined wisdom of thousands of Wikipedia editors.

Skylight helps improve maritime transparency and provides actionable intelligence to protect our oceans. Skylight features enable enforcement of maritime laws by: Identifying incursions or loitering by commercial fishing vessels in or near Marine Protected Areas, Highlighting where transshipments of fish or other goods may be occurring especially near or in a country's Exclusive Economic Zones, Tracking networks and enablers of illegal activity, such as vessels who bunker (re-fuel) other illegal fishing vessels

Organisation: Fraunhofer-Anwendungszentrum Industrial Automation des IOSB-INA, Hadi-Plast GmbH, IANUS Simulation GmbH, Technische Hochschule Ostwestfalen-Lippe (Institut für Energieforschung – iFE)
Kurzzusammenfassung: The Smart-E-Factory project is developing AI-based solutions to achieve sustainability goals in industry.

The vision is to create a free MI system that can predict the most important soil quality indicators without the need for expensive chemical laboratory tests and can be used directly by farmers of any level of education. The system should be able to make these predictions based on different data input sources such as satellite images, infrared spectral measurements, etc., and improve its prediction accuracy each time its predictions are cross-validated with chemical test data.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, HumanRights, OpenSourceInvestigation
Kurzzusammenfassung: Syrian Archive is a platform that makes it possible to find, collect, archive and collaboratively review visual evidence on social networks. It was funded by Prototypefund and uses VFRAME.

Projektname: The Ocean Clean Up/ Sustainable Coastlines
Kurzzusammenfassung: The Ocean Cleanup is a non-profit initiative working to rid the ocean of plastic and protect wildlife. AI was developed as part of the Microsoft Hackathon for Sustainability, all steps and applications used (Azure Microsoft) are communicated. AI is specifically used, for example, for object detection to map pollution.

Projektname: Tracking attacks on health care in Ukraine
Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, Democracy
Organisation: Insecurity Insights, Physicians for Human Rigths, DrivenData
Kurzzusammenfassung: Built a real-time, interactive map to visualize attacks on the Ukrainian health care system since the Russian invasion began in February of 2022. The map will support partner efforts to provide aid, hold aggressors accountable in court, and increase public awareness.

Art: Computer vision, Satellite imagery, Multisensor, Visualization
Kurzzusammenfassung: Partnership that will enable the UNFCCC to create a new AI-powered platform and global climate data hub. This platform will enable advanced analysis of global climate data through the creation of a new global climate data hub and an AI-powered data analytics platform. This will equip UNFCCC and member states with the tools they need to efficiently report and validate progress toward carbon reduction targets. This includes tracking transportation, agriculture, industrial processes, and other sources of carbon emissions. It will also provide UNFCCC and member states with tools to plan carbon reduction strategies using simulations, benchmarks, and data visualizations to help inform targeted actions, saving time and money.

Wekebere has developed a belt that can track the health parameters of mother and child. For example, it is able to monitor the foetus's movements and heartbeat, as well as the mother's health. The application recognises anomalies with the help of ML and can be used in many places due to its mobile application and low weight.

Delivering AI-backed tools that improve the health and resilience of our wildlands by supporting fire management.  The Wildlands team is working toward a proof-of-concept project to use machine learning to estimate the loading for 1, 10, and 100-hour fuels in Kg/m2 using photos taken with a digital camera or cell phone. This project will enable any forester with a camera to report quick, accurate fuel loading estimates, allowing fire managers, fuel specialists, and researchers to make more accurate planning predictions. This is part of a longer-term vision to apply machine learning to support many aspects of wildland fire management.

Einsatzbereich: Affordable and Clean Energy, Biodiversity, SustainableEngergy
Kurzzusammenfassung: Development of an AI-based geoinformation system for the selection of wind energy potential areas in the area of conflict between species, environmental and climate protection.

Zamba is the result of a competition by DrivenData, which uses computer vision to analyse wildlife camera videos. For example, typical false triggers without recognisable animals or images triggered by humans can be filtered out and animal species can be recognised. The model provided is able to recognise 31 animal species typically found in Central and West Africa and 10 Western European animal species.

Organisation: ConPolicy GmbH, Deutsches Forschungszentrum für Künstliche Intelligenz GmbH, Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft zur Förderung der angewandten Forschung e.V.
Kurzzusammenfassung: Better access and visibility of sustainability information in online retail through artificial intelligence.

Einsatzbereich: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions, DetectDisinformation, KnowledgeInfrastructure
Organisation: Alexander von Humboldt Insitut für Internet und Gesellschaft
Kurzzusammenfassung: This AI prototype recognises posts that have characteristics often associated with misinformation in research. It flags and categorises the content according to certain criteria. An overview of the categories, the Telegram channel and information on how to use Claimspotting can be found on the About page.
